page.title: 01AREA DESCRIPTION & ECOLOGY
page.content: This{RURAL AREA}of{Dorset}is scattered with farms & cottages & part of the small village of Gussage All Saints. The River Allen & the Cranborne- Wimborne road runs NE-SW. The East is part of the{Shaftesbury}& the West of the{Crichel Estates.}A modern dairy farm & small farming enterprises lie between. The river gives domestic water & fish. There are 2 pubs, 1 in the village, 1 at a cross roads & 1 Social Club. No doctor, school, shop or garage. Many{cottages}belong to the big estates, originally{tied}to estate jobs, but with reduced numbers of farm workers many are let to people working elsewhere. Some have been sold, & then they are usually modernised. The chalk soil produces an abundance of flowers, many, e.g.{cowslips,}are now rare. Bird life, both game & wild including threatened species abound.
